titleStmt.title: The Lord Keepers speech to the House of Commons, at the passing of two bills. Togeter [sic] with the Kings Majesties message to both Houses, concerning the raising of men for Ireland, the taking away of the bishops votes out of the House of Peeres, the banishing of popish priests, and the setling of the governement and liturgie of the church.
titleStmt.author: Littleton, Edward Littleton, Lord, 1589-1645.
England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I). aut

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Iohn Burroughes, and Iohn Franke,

notesStmt.note: A variant has the ornament inverted.
Thomason E.200[28] has the caption title: "The Kings Majesties gratious message to both Houses, Feb. 14. 1641.".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
